website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if quiet performance is your top concern, but it comes with the possibility of a few quirks.
pros: Earns praise for delivering quiet operation
Attractive styling looks great in modern bathrooms
cons: Some faulty units that failed to work properly have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over 688
customer_reviews.text: This fan replaced a Braun 688 that was driving us crazy. The house was built in 2012, but as usual the builder skimped on the fans. I did not have access to the fan from above, however the install only took about an hour. The hardest part of the job was removing the old fan, which was nailed in from the top and I had to use a large pry bar to remove those huge nails. I'll let the video speak for the sound improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Silverstreak2076

customer_reviews.title: Just what it says it is
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet. I have this running 24/7 in our attached-but-with-a-separate-outside-door-that-you-have-to-go-outside-to-get-to laundry room to keep the air flowing. It's been basically running non-stop for 2 years, and it's running like a champ. If you turn it off, and listen carefully, you can hear a difference, but it's quiet enough that you don't notice the noise when you go in there (and it's a tiny room). This is a quality product that's exactly what it claims to be. Nice, quiet fan that's efficient enough to leave running all the time without exploding your electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Stevish

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: So... the noise level is extremely low to the point that you can’t even tell if the unit is running. My husband complains because he can’t hide his poop sounds anymore but 🤷🏻‍♀️. It was also super simple to install. It is suupppppper tiny. The problem is that, since it is super tiny and the motor doesn’t run very hard or fast, it doesn’t pull air as some of the louder and bigger versions. It will service it purpose because it’s going in a small bathroom but I wouldn’t recommend it for large bathrooms that get used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Quiet quiet and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this fan. My bathrooms have contractor installed Broan fans. They are so noisy that I couldn't stay in the room one wall beside the bathroom when the fan is turned on. After replaced with Delta Breeze Slim, it's so quiet, comparatively, I know Panasonic fan is more quiet but more expensive, I don't even hear the fan when shower is on. This is exactly the same size of Broan fan so theoretically it should be an easy replace. But it took me more than one hour to complete the task. My first floor bathroom vent was difficult to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Way

customer_reviews.title: Not as Quiet as I thought...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bathroom fan to replace an old 80’s fan that was too loud 4.0 sonen. It was easy to install and all the parts and instructions were included and in perfect condition. For me the noise level was the main reason to buy this one and at 1.0 sonen level I expected a dramatic difference in sound. Unfortunately, even at 1.0 sonen i can still hear the fan from about 12 feet away and sitting under the fan on the toilet its definitely noticeable in sound. I would compare the sound level close to an old school oscillating fan on medium speed. Other than noise level everything else works great!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mattos

customer_reviews.title: I was able to swap out a current fan for this one, but it was not simple!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the current fan in my home had the vent and wiring going to the opposite side that the new fan had. I was able to remove the old unit and install the new one from the bathroom, without going into the attic. To remove the existing unit, I had to use a pry bar to force out the old installation nails. Then on the new unit I had to install wood screws in a different position than the instructions show. Once done it works great and is very quiet. I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SMF

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Not silent, but quiet enough I can't hear it over the shower. Huge improvement over the original fan. It was a bit of a pain to install as a replacement, mostly trying to hold it in place overhead while driving nails into some tough wood, with inadequate slack in the existing ducting. It would probably have been easier to drill and screw it in place. Take note: you will need three wire nuts and a strain relief bushing for the electrical connection; these are not supplied.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Quiet(er) but still very audible
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to install and replaced a cheap builder's grade fan. I did all the work without going into the attic. Some mess from the insullation falling out but I just didn't want to deal with the summer heat up there. However, I will say that the led light indicator may only be needed during the slow ramp-up start (about 10 seconds), but once at full speed this fan still makes very audible fan noise. Your impression will probably be that it's about half the noise from before.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Far Lower Power
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace a broan 690 in the laundry room which gets a lot of use. Took about one hour to install, only notes is I needed to cut the drywall about an extra half inch and power is on the other side. This unit is insanely quiet and smooth. I measured the old fan at 65 watts - about 10 times more power consumption than the Delta SLM50. Well worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Selkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful and water condenses on the unit.
customer_reviews.text: As a previous poster mentioned this unit condenses water inside of it, which drips from the grate. I've checked the vent hose to be sure it was properly installed and angled, and all is done correctly. It's ok if you shower quickly, but stay in there for 15 minutes with hot water, and the room easily steams up and you get the dripping issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow! A real fan for a good price and quiet too.
customer_reviews.text: Go this to replace the lowest builder grade fan I've ever seen. You could hear the old one across the house with all the doors closed. Build quality is good and the entire fan assembly is a molded plastic unit that screws into the housing. The only noise is the sound of the air moving. This is Quieter (is that a word?) than fans twice the price and happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WaltRTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as quiet as expected
customer_reviews.text: This product is not 1 sone, I measured a 11db increase from ambient. Although sones and decibels are not linearly related, 40db ambient is about 2.5 sones, 51db with fan running is just about 5 sones. Don’t get me wrong, it is relatively quiet, but not 1.0 sone quiet. I may try to add some rubber o-rings to mounting ears to see if this helps.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieK

customer_reviews.title: The fan is super quiet, and my spouse thinks it is not ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan is super quiet, and my spouse thinks it is not working well because it's not loud like our prior fan. My only complaint is the difficulty of installing as a replacement. If it was for a new home, it would be fine. But as a replacement, the bracket for the hose connection makes inserting into the existing space almost impossible without cutting out extra space. I managed to install with minimal additional opening of the wall, and luckily the kit includes a larger grill cover to cover the additional opening. Other than that, the fan works great, and does move the air quickly, even if my wife doesn't believe it !
customer_reviews.author: midtncpl

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of this quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the original bathroom fan with this one. I love it - it's quite quiet, much quieter than the cheap original unit. There is a small LED visible inside while the unit is on, a nice touch as it is so quiet, you may not know that it's on! I addedto automatically turn off the fan after a set time.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for builder grade broan fan
customer_reviews.text: I followed Ute K directions on using the interior parts as a replacement for the builder grade broan fan. It was very helpful having the directions and also his list of additional needed parts. I was able to replace the fan from the interior of the house as the attic is not accessible. Plan about 45 minutes for the first one. If you do multiple it’s probably 30 minutes per fan. This fan is much quieter and clears the room just as quickly as the original fan.
customer_reviews.author: Marko87

customer_reviews.title: Better, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how loud this really is, but it sounds a good but louder than the one sone fan I have. It's an improvement over the rattletrap noise storm that the builders put there, and it's well built. So maybe I'm being unfair at four stars, but it didn't impress me noise wise. This was my trial attempt, and I put this in a bathroom that isn't used much, but I'll be getting something else for the others.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price - not silent!
customer_reviews.text: Decent fan for the price. These are not silent as you would expect for the 1.0 Sone rating and there is no need for the green light to indicate it's on as there is still a fair bit of fan noise however a major improvement to the old ones in my condo. I replaced all 3 bathroom fans - 2 with 50CFM and one with 70CFM. I wish they would reduce the RPM of the fan to reduce the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Speecer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: This fan was really quiet after the install. Had to look at the LED to see whether this was working. After a few months got louder and noisier. Contacted customer support via email but no response or help in fixing the issue!
customer_reviews.author: cool guy

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, but Aamazon failed to find installer.
customer_reviews.text: Disliked that Amazon only made halfway effort to find installer. Their installers wait around for big installs. Amazon needs to get some smaller electrical installers who would be happy for the work. The compensation rate is 2 hours of labor locally.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these Delta SLM50 vent fans and they work great and are extremely quiet (1 sone). It took me 30 minutes, per vent, to remove my old vent fan and setup the new vent fan, which came fully assembled. Literally, my kids could have installed these vent fans as they were that easy. The SLM50 is also half the size of my old Broan vent fan which was only a few years old and seems archaic at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan.
customer_reviews.text: It came with only a 3" outlet adapter. Very quiet; not sure whether 1 sone is accurate. I have a 0.5 sone Panasonic 50 cfm fan too, and it's very nearly silent. this one hums slightly. Measured watts are about 6. The Panasonic ecm (DC) fan measures 12 watts at the same conditions, though its 4" duct is 50 feet long, while the Delta duct is very short. This fan is VERY efficient, and 1/2 the price of other ecm-motor fans. I think it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fan
customer_reviews.text: I've installed about 10 of these for my remodels. By far the best of the best. It makes sense why the big box stores do not have this on their shelf, they can't compete with the price, power, and performance (emphasis on price). If this fan was on their shelf, they wouldn't sell most of the junk they have imo.
customer_reviews.author: Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Worthy pretty quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced original helicopter fan, this is much quieter , required above average skills to diy, probably 2 hours if this is the first bathroom fan you replace.
customer_reviews.author: AMF

customer_reviews.title: Basic Fan That Just Works
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic fan that just works. Basic installation, and no problems. Takes a couple of seconds for the fan to get up to speed and you hear the noise gradually getting louder. It is pretty quiet, but still clearly audible. I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Seavey

customer_reviews.title: Works, definitely quiet, but I'd go one size larger than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is really quit, but I'm not sure it really has the power to move air like my older unit. I had to hold a trash bag up to it to test if it was really moving air. It depleted all the air in the bag so I knew it was working, but I might go with the larger unit next time even though I sized it correctly for the room it's in. Just make sure your doors have space under them to get in fresh air and help pull moist air out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: QUIET!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are doing a much needed bathroom remodel. I am so glad that we spent a little extra money and changed out the existing fan in the bathroom and put in a quiet one. What a difference!! I debated about doing it since the other one still worked, carbon footprint, blah blah blah. But, It really is nice. I would highly recommend this fan. The cost was great for what it is and trust me, I shopped around.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie36

customer_reviews.title: Works great, VERY quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and is very quiet (so much so that I wasn't sure if it was working until I got closer to it. Made me think of when the Prius first came out and no one knew if it was on or not. Installing was relatively easy but removing my old one was EXTREMELY difficult. I would highly recommend you remove old one first before ordering a new one. In hindsight, I should have just found a fan replacement as everything was easy to remove except the housing which didn't really NEED to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: M. Diment

customer_reviews.title: Rattles...
customer_reviews.text: Fan makes a rattle noise that is obnoxious, fan has to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, wish it moved a bit more air.
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet... Doesn't seem to move quite as much air as the old Braun fan, but I can hear myself think in the bathroom so its a fair trade off. I also bought a Delta 70cfm fan for another bathroom, it seems to work better than the old Braun did, and only slightly noisier than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Brackets make awkward for instal
customer_reviews.text: brackets to screw into stud shouldn’t be extension of the 7.25” box. Not easy To put through hole In drywall with the 1” brackets on each side of the metal box. Should be able to screw into stud from inside the metal box.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 40 yr old fan with this one! It was very easy to replace the old fan. I did have to make the ceiling hole a bit bigger. I used screws rather than nails to attach it to the joist. It is unbelievably quiet and it definitely moves the air. Perfect replacement and a real energy saver. I am a 60 yr old woman and did all of the work myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca K

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a quiet fan for my small cabin's bathroom, and this fit the bill perfectly — you can barely hear it at all when it's on. The CFM is probably less than what a typical bathroom would need, but it's just right for my small bathroom (5'x5').
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: No more fart smells!
customer_reviews.text: Simple review: Installed in bathroom... now there is no more lingering poop smell. Fresh as before the dump was dumped!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Flath

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how quiet it is given that it is so reasonably priced. It takes a few seconds to get spinning, but once it does, you know it is doing its job. Installs just like any other ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Loebsack

customer_reviews.title: ... a truck engine old Nutone Broan POS builder grade crap Wanted the Panasonic whisper quiet at 0
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a truck engine old Nutone Broan POS builder grade crap Wanted the Panasonic whisper quiet at 0.3 sones but didn't want to cut open drywall This Delta fits a standard 50CFM square older style fan. SOlid performance ,fairly quiet,but NO Panasonic level quiet. Easy to install as well Good value and performance
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but a small scraping noise I can't stop.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but a small scraping noise I can't stop. Love the efficient brushless motor and it is quiet except for a small scraping noise I can't seem to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McCray

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I did expect it to be a little bit quieter but compared to the old fan it's very quiet. Sturdier than the usual cheap install you get with a house and was fairly easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: michele helm

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: sometimes I wish it was louder :) So I will know for sure it is working I really think it was a great buy Buy with confidence - Home depot has quiet ones for too much money.
customer_reviews.author: Olenka

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a very old and very noisy unit. This fit just right and the is very quiet for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: toniv

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little exhaust.
customer_reviews.text: The exhaust fan works well. It was a little small for the space in my ceiling. I will have to patch that up and paint. The plus is that the moisture level and mold have Been stopped. It isn’t very loud. A little quieter than a house fan set on low.
customer_reviews.author: Coty

customer_reviews.title: A good fan overall
customer_reviews.text: I like the fan, it was easy to install in my small 1/2 bathroom/powder room. I still think it’s a little loud when the fan is on. But it’s much better than what I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Good but Loader Than Claimed
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in a closet for receivers. It sounds loader than expected. Per my measurement, its noise is not 1 sones but 62 dB (~4 sones). I brought this because I got Delta Electronics GBR80 Breez months ago which is much quieter than my old one. Delta Electronics GBR80 Breez has actual 55 dB noise (3 sones instead of 0.6 sones) and my old one has 73 dB.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quite and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a champ in the existing opening, very simple to install and wire. I had no problem following the instructions and installing it from below (that is within the bathroom). Definitely the quietest bathroom fan I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Kjellman

customer_reviews.title: Noise level of 1.0 sones is a lie
customer_reviews.text: fan is not quite as ad. Noise level of 1.0 sones is a lie. feel like a 3.0. don't want to return it since i already installed, i guess i just stuck with this for a wile and get a better one when this one broke.
customer_reviews.author: edison wang

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement fan
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect replacement for our old Broan fan. It's quiet but still provides a nice amount of ambient noise so you don't hear folks doing their business. I feel sorry for the saps who buy noisy Nutone fans at HD, their selection of fans is pitiful. The slow start feature is really genius. I only wish Delta would design the fan with mounting brackets on both sides of the housing . It's not that you can't mount it from either side but I'd feel better if I could use the intended mounting flaps rather than just drilling through the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Jen S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality vent fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality vent fan. Its much quieter than your typical bathroom fan although it isn't completely quiet. I'd say it's about half as loud as most others. It's built well and relatively easy to install for a ceiling application. Overall I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, good quiet value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent exhaust fan that is quieter than I expected. In fact, so quiet I decided to install a timer switch because I found myself leaving it on. The on/off LED indicator is useless for me because I can't see it unless directly under the fan given how the grill ended up sitting vs. my position standing in the bathroom. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: wildcatgoal

customer_reviews.title: Mine was dripping water until ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed a insulated flexible duct. I live in Michigan so everything was okay until it got cold. I might have spent more on the duct than the fan itself, Home Depot only sold a 25 foot size. I used 3 zip ties to attach it at the top. The fan works okay, nothing special, my mirror still fogs up but not as bad without the fan. I went up on the roof and I can feel the air coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Manders

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and keeps out the fog.
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed this very easily to replace our super loud one in our bathroom (approx 4’x10’) and the 1/2 bath (4’x8’). These are so much quieter. Also our mirror never fogs up in the bathroom anymore after a shower.
customer_reviews.author: TishaTop Contributor: Harry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Silent
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Is silent. I can finally hear a fart...that's what she said!
customer_reviews.author: Sameer

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: We don’t normally write reviews but this fan is better than the Nutone models (from the big box stores) that my husband has previously installed. It’s quieter, build quality is better and my husband definitely recommends it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie M. Purnell

customer_reviews.title: This unit is quite (~1 Sones) and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This unit is quite (~1 Sones) and easy to install. But be extremely careful and wear gloves, as the sheet metal box has RAZOR sharp edges and WILL lay you open!! Other than that I like the unit.
customer_reviews.author: B. Debley

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, works for our half bath
customer_reviews.text: No bath fan is easy to install if the drywall is already up. Over all though I’m happy with the product and I’m sure my wife is as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Lot of hype than what it is
customer_reviews.text: Not as quite as mentioned . Also the installation took more time than expected. It has side hooks/prongs that needs more cut than the box opening. Though the box size is exactly matching with builder fan, dry wall work is inevitable. No , I won’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, not silent, power efficient
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, not silent. Replaced builder provided junk that was sounding like a jumbo jet with this one. Still not as quiet as some panasonic one used before, but the duct is only 3 inch, so I had to with 3 inch compatible one. It has much lower power consumption compared to builder provided. Overall for price it is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: nsr

customer_reviews.title: Install was easy, which took about half hour
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy, which took about half hour. Used the existing duct and taped it to the adapter. As usual the hardest part is removing the old. Since the old was installed when the ceiling was exposed, I had to rip the housing by hand, which took about an hour. It's a lot quieter than the old, but not whisper quiet. The led light is not necessary since I can clearly hear the fan when it's on.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lai

customer_reviews.title: I was looking around for an exhaust fan that would ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking around for an exhaust fan that would fit 3 inch duct pipe; and came across this one on Amazon. Fits perfectly and is way quieter than all fans I have.
customer_reviews.author: ActualCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Mounting screws not included.
customer_reviews.text: The only negatives are the sketchy instructions and no mounting screws included. It appeared as though mounting screws were supposed to be taped to the product; however, none were included on mine. The fan works well and is much quieter than the one it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Dale K.

customer_reviews.title: Replacing old unit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect drop in replacement for our 15 year old fan in the 1/2 bath. So much quieter!
customer_reviews.author: refchick247

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Damn good fan! Really “sucks” lol! Clears the air in my bathroom with no problem! Highly recommended! Fast shipping also
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for a silent exhaust fan.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good thing this fan has a little (tiny) green led that lights up when it is on, because I would not be able to hear it.
customer_reviews.author: 357_Sig_P239

customer_reviews.title: Vary Vary Quiet , Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Supper quiet , hard to tell if it is on low noise . love it , works great
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: I like it so much, I'm buying another one.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this afternoon. Fit perfectly and moves much more air than the "builder unit". It' quiet, but not totally silent. I'm going to order another one for the guest bathroom, too. This is a great product based on performance and price.
customer_reviews.author: DaveTX

customer_reviews.title: Too much noise after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: This product makea too much noise after 6 months of use. It worked great for first few weeks, but the noise level kept going up with use.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav Nemade

customer_reviews.title: The best fans i ever DIDNT hear in the bathroom ever
customer_reviews.text: The best fans i ever DIDNT hear in the bathroom ever !! I bought one for each of my bathrooms. I hated hearing the sound of the fans when the light was on. NOW I DONT HEAR ANYTHING !!!!
customer_reviews.author: ca mom

customer_reviews.title: ... cat box (old 2 sided dresser) and it works great. It's not the quiestest fan
customer_reviews.text: Used as ventilation in an enclosed cat box (old 2 sided dresser) and it works great. It's not the quiestest fan, but for the price it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Clara W.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I loveeeeeeee how quiet it is, harldy hear it kick on. It really pulls alot of air for its size and quietness
customer_reviews.author: Athena haley

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice fan. Its replacing a much louder bathroom fan ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice fan. Its replacing a much louder bathroom fan so that in itself skews my review to the positive. Is it the best fan ever, I'm not sure-but I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Install was a breeze and i didnt need to climb up into my attic which was the best part.
customer_reviews.author: Fire and Glass

customer_reviews.title: quiet and fits in a small space
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had a problem. It worked for a few minutes, I think, and then it sounded wobbly and never got up to speed. The replacement works fine. A big plus was that it fit in the same space as my old fan. The Delta Breez is very quiet compared to my old cheap LOUD fan. I am very pleased with the Delta Breez SLM50 exhaust fan!
customer_reviews.author: My Reviews 4U

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the vented litterbox area I made
customer_reviews.text: OMG it is soooooo quiet! Perfect for the vented litterbox area I made. I am sure it would be great on a bathroom aswell.
customer_reviews.author: DJmaya

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just installed. Looks great, and seems to be high quality. Very quiet :) Time tells all.
customer_reviews.author: im101

customer_reviews.title: Quite
customer_reviews.text: The noise reduction and price make this on of the best things I've ever bought for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fan was engineered well except that the standard cable ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan was engineered well except that the standard cable connector locknut I used had to be filed down so that the supplied wiring cover would fit. If you are aware of this beforehand, you can do a dry run with your connector before installing the fan housing and maybe save yourself a lot of cussing.
customer_reviews.author: Avalanche Lily

customer_reviews.title: Too weak
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be quieter and more powerful, but the most disappointing is its power.
customer_reviews.author: Kazar

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to replace a noisy one in the guest bathroom. What a difference! You can barely hear it!
customer_reviews.author: KJZBoston

customer_reviews.title: It is very quiet for a small vent fan
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered to replace a louder builder installed fan from 20 plus years ago. This one is quieter than the original one ever was.
customer_reviews.author: MARY ELLEN LAPP

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Why don't builders install fans this nice in most houses?
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our builder-grade fan with this one, and wish we'd done it ages ago. It's quiet, powerful, and energy-efficient. It also looks good installed.
customer_reviews.author: Papaya Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's  quite
customer_reviews.text: Finally found one that does not hurt my ears from the sound. I will be buying more for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M Butler

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, actually forget it's on because it's so quiet.
customer_reviews.author: MeowMomma

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised. Quiet. The former fan sounded like a jet taking off. Easy Install, if you are good with basic tools and skillsets.
customer_reviews.author: reynold Hicklin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Great product that was exactly as advertised. Easy to install and very quiet (about the same noise level as the refrigerator compressor motor). I'd definitely buy unit this again.
customer_reviews.author: MRT

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is quiet, easy to install, just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Aznas

customer_reviews.title: very quiet fan. Fits into the space from which ...
customer_reviews.text: very quiet fan. Fits into the space from which I removed an older fan.
customer_reviews.author: sammo

customer_reviews.title: Not really quiet
customer_reviews.text: It's not as quiet as I expected it to be judging from other reviews. I'll not buy this fan for another bathroom. Better pay extra $50 for a really quiet one.
customer_reviews.author: Amigor

customer_reviews.title: It's really quiet to the point that I have to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really quiet to the point that I have to check to see if it's even working! Does it's job well without screaming at you.
customer_reviews.author: jefff

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet low volume ventilation fan
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet, low volume ventilation fan. Installed in a basement crawl space. FYI cannot use a dimmer switch. Actually no need for one.
customer_reviews.author: JVH

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The Delta Breez SLM50 exhaust fan was very quiet for a week then got progressively louder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a lot better than the home dumpo stuff i replaced
customer_reviews.text: a lot better than the home dumpo stuff i replaced, what a difference . buy it . its not too bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ian P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to install but is a bit larger than I wanted. It's much more quiet than the freight train sound it replaced, but not whisper quiet. But then I'm told a little noisy provides some privacy for quests using a powder room.
customer_reviews.author: n2scuba

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This thing is very quiet. Much quieter than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: John Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan and Installation
customer_reviews.text: Great Fan and Installation, a tiny bit noisier than i had expected but overall very nice !! Slim Profile makes easy for a no attic access situation.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I love these fans
customer_reviews.text: I love these fans. Ultra quiet. They are much nicer than the standard builder grade. I routinely install these into homes I remodel.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smart

customer_reviews.title: Better than most
customer_reviews.text: Compact, relatively fan that does a good job at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: andrew nadraus

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 12 months
customer_reviews.text: Fan started running significantly slower after 10months of use and now it does not run during showering.
customer_reviews.author: DAEHO

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most quiet out there but honestly very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Prybar

customer_reviews.title: Relatively quiet, but gets 3x noisier when you attach exhaust hose.
customer_reviews.text: Still pretty noisy once you attach an exhaust hose of any length. My unit was nearly inaudible at first. When I finally installed an exhaust hose the noise tripled. I guess the friction backpressure forces the fan to work harder and get noisy. Since mine is only a "fart fan" for a half-bath, and won't carry moisture, I cut the hose back to just 3' to get it above the insulation. This cut the noise considerably, but it was wtill 3x louder than with no hose. The noise is not bad, though. It's fine. I'm just saying it's not as silent as the specs would lead you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Empyreal

customer_reviews.title: A decent, fairly quiet, mid price small fan ...
customer_reviews.text: A decent, fairly quiet, mid price small fan. The electric connection cover plate screw was too tiny--a pain to assemble for any one with hands larger than a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Silently works!
customer_reviews.text: Value for money spent and noisy old one gone for good.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great fan at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an existing fan which was so loud and very happy with what I bought .. would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: DELTA ELECTRONICS (AMERICAS) LTD. BreezSlim SLM50 50 CFM Exhaust Bath Fan, White
product_meta.description:
The Delta BreezSlim SLM50 is a compact-sized, low noise, valued priced ENERGY STAR qualified fan. Perfect for single home retrofits as well as large multifamily projects. UL listed for both ceiling and sidewall installation. Fits inside a 4" wall. Air flow of 50 CFM with loudness rating of 1.0 sone. Features a DC brushless motor for extended reliability and low power consumption. 6.4 Watts with efficiency rating of 8.9 CFM per Watt. ENERGY STAR qualified and HVI certified.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Breez Ventilation Fan combines several design innovations, including a switching power supply and DC brushless motor to provide a quieter solution with energy savings up to 74% compared to similar products. The Breez Ventilation Fan is easy to install
feature_bullets: PERFORMANCE: DC motor fan is tested to run continuously for 70,000 hours (8 years)
LOW NOISE: Shower in peace with a noise level of 2.0 sones
EFFICIENT: Energy savings of up to 85% makes it easy on your wallet
RETROFIT-READY: Slim profile is perfect for retrofit, ceiling or wall-mount installation
POWERFUL: 50 CFM circulates fresh air up to 50 sq. ft.
ENERGY STAR certified by the EPA

specifications.Warranty Description: Limited 3 year warranty manufacturer defects, offered by manufacturer
